sourceMeaningMnemonic: You should <radical>stop</radical> to buy <radical>stamp</radical>s at <radical>noon</radical> because that's the only time they're being sold at <kanji>wholesale</kanji> price. Everyone's so busy eating and working and being at school, that they miss this awesome deal, but not you. Everyday at noon you stock up on wholesale stamps. Do you send a lot of mail? No, you probably just collect them. But they were cheap, so who cares!
meaningInfo: Imagine yourself stopping at the empty bank at noon, grabbing a handful of wholesale stamps. So many stamps. So few extra charges.
readingMnemonic: Oh, one more thing. Going at noon isn't enough, you have to say the password to get them at <kanji>wholesale</kanji> price too. The password is "<reading>Oh Roshi</reading>" (<ja>おろし</ja>). Okay, so maybe that's just the name of the guy there, but it always works when I want to get stamps wholesale so you should do it too!
readingInfo: "Oh Roshi" you say carefully as you hand your stamps over at noon. The guy raises an eyebrow at you, but gives you them wholesale! It worked!
